properties.name: camel.component.aws-translate.auto-discover-client
properties.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-translate.autodetect-source-language
properties.description: Being able to autodetect the source language

properties.name: camel.component.aws-translate.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-translate.configuration
properties.description: The component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws.translate.TranslateConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-translate.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws-translate component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-translate.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-translate.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Translate client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-translate.proxy-port
properties.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Translate client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-translate.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Translate client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-translate.region
properties.description: The region in which Translate client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1) You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

properties.name: camel.component.aws-translate.translate-client
properties.description: To use a existing configured AWS Translate as client. The option is a com.amazonaws.services.translate.AmazonTranslate type.
